reviews.text: The Arran House was a pleasant surprise for weary travelers. With 3 of us crammed into one room, there wasn't a lot of extra space, but the room had been decorated with care and the clean and cheery "white bed" look, topped with colorful throws, made me feel right at home. There was a desk and chair and two dressers as well as a cupboard - lots of storage space. The retro-fit bathroom in the corner was a marvel of engineering ingenuity - tiny, but it served well and the shower worked fine. Towels were attractively laid out and ample. The breakfast room was well-staffed and a hive of activity in the morning - there was a great hot buffet with loads of choice, and good cold breakfast foods, plus newspapers to read. A common room on the ground floor had a TV to watch, reading material, comfy couches, and the Internet station (which I didn't use and it was not free.) Staff were forthcoming with information, maps, and directions. The hallways are under renovation right now so they don't look great, but there was no inconvenience. There's a lovely garden at the back and the whole place was really quiet. I would not hesitate to go back - but book well ahead...I couldn't get in for an additional night when my plans changed!
reviews.title: Charming and convenient

reviews.text: Our group at Arran House Hotel consisted of our son and his girlfriend, younger son, and us, not-quite-so-young couple. There are 4 tube stops close, closest of which is Goodge St. It's very convenient to British Museum, Univ. of London. There was a college student group staying, but that wasn't a problem- they had a party one evening in the garden and invited my son in. Breakfast was great- it was a buffet so there was no waiting, you could take what you wanted from typical English breakfast items, typical continental breakfast items, rolls, nutella, yogurt, fresh fruit. We had a fourth floor room, so had to lug our bags up, but we did it. Since this was August, the room was a bit warm but a large oscillating fan was provided and we slept well. The room itself was an acceptable size, bed linens and pillows were of very high quality. The en-suite bathroom was one of those molded affairs ; it looked small but was quite serviceable. My son and girlfriend rode bikes from St Pancras station to the hotel. There is a bike route which keeps one off the busy streets. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, great breakfast

reviews.text: This place was one of a couple I was recommended by the staff at the Ridgemont Hotel, who lost my email booking and then by the time it was found were fully booked and could not offer me a room.
reviews.title: mixed experience

reviews.text: On the positives, this place is in a good location and includes a full English breakfast in the tariff. The bed was comfortable and room included flatscreen TV and free wireless internet which was very helpful. Staff were initially very friendly and made me feel welcome. The B&B has a lovely private garden in the back. The guest lounge has lots of information about the local area which was also very helpful. I had a room with shared bathroom, the bathrooms were clean and I don't recall ever having to wait to use the shower or toilet.
reviews.title: a tidy hotel

reviews.text: On the negatives, my room was noisy and hot. I was on the first floor overlooking the street. Luckily there was a fan in the wardrobe which helped a bit. However I needed earplugs every night I stayed. None of the staff offered to help move my suitcase upstairs. The staircase is steep and narrow, and it was definitely difficult to get a suitcase up and down, even one that is not particularly large. There was minor renovation works happening at the time of my visit. Though not noisy, I had to walk through this to use the shared toilet and shower facilities and a couple of times I came out of the shower to find several tradesmen on the stairwell painting. It was a little uncomfortable. Several times I went out into the garden and found empty beer bottles and dirty glasses left out there by other guests.
reviews.title: Very nice B&B
Best breakfast in years
reviews.text: The hotel is a couple of houses knocked together which gives it a very home-from-home feeling. Excellent and efficient welcome. We had a room with a large double bed and a single bed, and a very tiny module containing loo, basin, and shower. This was an issue - it was hard to sit on the loo without your knees touching the door, and the shower would be too tiny for anyone much overweight.
We slept brilliantly - highly comfortable bed (I am fussy about beds), quiet, ceiling fan if required but actually the road was not noisy so we had the window open a bit.
reviews.title: An unexpected treasure...

reviews.text: The high spot is the breakfast. Everything is made in small batches so it doesn't get tired. The sausages, bacon and mushrooms really tasted great. The best of all was the scrambled egg, done just right. Cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit as well. In the warm weather you can eat your breakfast in the garden. Great place, and the helpful staff would be a real asset if you did not know London well. Definitely one to return to.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed -family of 5

reviews.text: I stopped by in London for 2 nights (22 & 23 Oct 09) after a conference in Hungary. My previous experiences in B&Bs in central London were only satisfactory so i wasn't expecting much. Arran House surprised me very nicely.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms but very clean.

reviews.text: Hotel staff helped me with my queries on how to get there from Heathrow, even offering to book a taxi for me. But I discovered the Dot.to.Dot hotel hopper service was a much more reasonable and comfortable way to get to hotels in central London (GBP34 for return door-to-door service)
reviews.title: Excellent location, comfortable, quiet and good value for London

reviews.text: Travelling with three children made finding a hotel challenging of not almost impossible. Came across Arran House Hotel and thought this must be too good to be true. Five in a room, good location, breakfast included and a great rate. Reviews looked good so booked it. From the first correspondance they were helpful and friendly. Took care of booking us a ride from the airport.
reviews.title: Great find!!!

reviews.text: Room was tiny and the bathroom even smaller - hot water a good pressure but you could not turn around in the shower. There was one double and three singles - not much storage. We were on he street so lots of noise. Beds were comfy and we all slept well.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was served each morning. Cereals, pastries as well as hot food items. They even opened the room up early on the day of our departure.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in brilliant location

reviews.text: Easy walk to the bus and underground. Would fefinately stay there again and recommend to friends. For the price it cannot be beat,
reviews.title: Good, but not what it seemed

reviews.text: We were at the hotel two nights in March, the location was great, very good hospitality, comfortable beds.very Good breakfast , highly recommends the place
reviews.title: Best dorm rooms in London!! You'll feel like you're cheating!!

reviews.text: While this hotel is clean and warm and the buffet breakfast is good value we were very disappointed with the tiny room we were given having booked 5 months in advance a quiet quad ensuite room We got a room which had a double bed, one single bed,and a fold away bed placed across the fireplace next to the ensuite door We could hardly open the ensuite door.Ttere was a fold away table in the room but there was no space to open it Tthe room was noisy as it overlooked gower st.When we expressed our concerns we were told a room change was not possible as the hotel was fully booked. After two nights and the clear message that the room was impossible for us to continue in and we would be checking out we did get a non ensuite room with a double amd two single beds overlooking the garden and were more comfortable. I would not advise this hotel for families unless there are much larger rooms that we are not aware of.
reviews.title: disappointing we had booked 6 months in advance a quiet quad room, we got a tiny noisy room overlooking the street.

reviews.text: We are heading back to the Arran House for the fourth time! It is in a great location with the Goodge Street underground just a couple of blocks away. They provide a great breakfast as well which keeps you full up til dinner. And for dinner....I would highly recommend going to Zizzi's which is only about 4 or 5 blocks away. It is reasonable, and they serve great Italian food...almost as good as what we've had in Italy!! Try them out and definately try out Arran House!
reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay!!

reviews.text: Arran House Hotel is the only place to stay in central London!
reviews.title: Exceptional Treatment

reviews.text: We planned to spend 4 nights there in December at the start of our EU, UK trip but due to the snow and airport closings we wound up returning to Arran (Thank God they could take us!!) for an additional three nights,
reviews.title: Wonderful base for a single, middle-aged woman exploring London on her own!

reviews.text: A wonderful and helpful staff, and congenial atmosphere, convenient location, terrific breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms, excellent value,... I could go on, All in all, certainly the highpoint of our London experience!!!
reviews.title: Arran exceeded my hopes & expectations
